Column Comment.0: LITHOLOGY LOG ID: A unique identifier for a descriptive record of lithology.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: DEPTH OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for the depth interval for this lithinterval. Use LITH LOG to get the top and base depths.
Column Comment.3: LITHOLOGIC ROCK TYPE: Type of rock comprising a significant portion of theinterval. For example, the predominant rock type in the interval may be coal, or ooliticlimestone or calcareous sandstone.
Column Comment.4: ROCK TYPE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique sequence number enablingstorage of multiple descriptions for descriptive logs.
Column Comment.5: ROCKPART NAME: Name of the component found within the interval, which can beany type of accessory contained within the interval (e.g., rock types like chert,concretion, glauconite, or fossils like crinoids or brachiopods).
Column Comment.6: LITHOLOGIC COLOR: Basic color or color adjective of lithologic components suchas red, grey, blue etc.
Column Comment.7: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.8: LITHOLOGIC COLOR: Basic color or color adjective of lithologic components suchas red, grey, blue etc.
Column Comment.9: LITHOLOGIC DISTRIBUTION :Describes the distribution of the rock color in thesub-interval. For example, the color distribution maybe graded, uneven, etc.
Column Comment.10: DOMINANT INDICATOR: A flag to indicate if the described color is the dominant rockcolor. A Y(es) indicates that the color is dominant and a N(o) represents that the coloris not dominant.
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: LITHOLOGIC INTENSITY: Rock color intensity. The color intensity is used todescribe the amount of color associated with the sample. For example, the colorintensity may range from high to low.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: WEATHERED INDICATOR: A flag, either Y or N, indicating if the described rockcolor is from a weathered surface. Y means that the color is described from aweathered rock surface and NOT from a freshly exposed surface.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
